name: Financial Services Consumer Panel
membership: The Panel is a partner organisation with BEUC, the European Consumers' Association.
goal:
The Panel is an independent statutory body, set up to represent the interests of consumers in the development of policy for the regulation of financial services.
It works to advise and challenge the UK's Financial Conduct Authority from the earliest stages of its policy development to ensure it takes into account the consumer interest.
The Panel also takes a keen interest in broader issues for consumers in financial services where it believes it can help achieve beneficial change/outcomes for consumers.
Members of the Panel are recruited through a process of open competition and encompass a broad range of relevant expertise and experience.
interests: Banking and financial services, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Single market
